main_definition: To lift or elevate something, to increase the amount of money paid to someone as a form of compensation, or to cause a higher level of concern, attention, or alertness.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To physically lift an object from one position to another
meanings_and_examples.example: She raised the glass of water to her lips.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To increase the amount of money paid to someone for their work or services
meanings_and_examples.example: The company decided to raise the salary of its employees by 10%.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cause a higher level of concern, attention, or alertness
meanings_and_examples.example: The alarm raised when he entered unauthorized areas in the building.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To elevate someone's rank or position
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of hard work, she was finally able to raise her status and become a manager.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To bring up children in an educational or moral way
meanings_and_examples.example: The couple is focused on raising their kids with good values.
